Comment_contributor: (The little finger on left hand is counted by bending it down toward palm.)
(The ring finger on same hand is bent to join the little finger.)
(The middle finger on same hand is bent in the same manner.)
lit. ‘one hand’ (The thumb is bent to cover the fingers.)
(The little finger on right hand is bent. The same pattern is repeated on the left hand.)
lit. ‘two hands’ (Both hands are joined together thumbs straight and knuckles together.)

Value: or kabe ap-a or ŋit kabe
